result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank E Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To pay restitution plus any statutorily authorized surcharges.

To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  No contact with Econo Foods.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessmen, it.

timeConds.notes: 60 DAYS STAYED.  To be used at the Court's discretion by petition from Dept. of Corrections. Huber release granted. To commence forthwith.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to 16-CF-55, 15-CM-19, 15-CM-119, 15-CM-147 & 15-CM-160. Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action.
Court converts restitution owing to a civil judgment.
Concurrent to Ct. 1. Credit for time served.
To pay the costs of the action.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Defense gives sentencing argument.  Defendant apologizes, makes statement to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

records.addlTxt: Defense Discovery Demand

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 1 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 3. Court dismisses remaining counts but reads in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer asks court to set matter for a waiver of preliminary hearing. Bond remains in effect.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted by jail staff.

No contact direct or indirect with Econo Foods.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Frank E Thomas in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant Frank E Thomas in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schaefer only learned about new charges this morning, has not been appointed by PD to represent defendant on this file yet. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Court adjourns matter to allow counsel to be appointed in this matter. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
